Perhaps you would be so kind as to satisfy my curiosity about you and your people.

You clearly are not from Val Oriyn. So why have you come here?You explain about the demokrons' attack.

Who would have thought that the magic of the archdevans would spread so far...?

We have made many attempts to stop them,
but it's not easy.

We will do our best to help you stop the archdevas."Tell me more about the Vault of Oriyn."

The Vault of Oriyn is a special place where Oriyn's Arcana are kept, which contain enormous knowledge.

With the help of Oriyn's Arcana, an answer can always be found, but... "But?"

Anyone who wishes to read Oriyn's Arcana must first undergo Oriyn's trial.

You would be putting your life on the line.

If you are prepared to do that, read the old book in front of you."Okay."

The companions passed Oriyn's trial in order to find the secret behind the Dreamstorm and the demokron invasion, but Dakuryon, who had been disguised as Madat, captured High Elder Verikam along with Oriyn's Arcana. In the process, Dakuryon became interested in Zolyn, who has resistance against dark magic.

"The Archedevan Invasion:

"Long ago, archdevan sorcerers learned the foul secrets of blood magic, and used it to alter their forms.

"The blood magicians passed their knowledge on to others, who used it for many vile purposes, altering other living creatures to suit their whims.

"But then came Dakuryon, who saw in blood magic a means to conquest—and in conquest, a means to expand his knowledge of blood magic: a never-ending cycle of madness and death.
"Not content with Northern Arun, Dakuryon used his blood magic to pierce the Storm Barrier and invade the rest of the world, while he disguised himself as..."Turn the page to learn more.
(The glyphs covering the surface of the cubes mean nothing to you—except perhaps one...)<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Something about this one..."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Know, mortal, that Oriyn's knowledge lives on in the Arcana.

All truths are found herein—for good or for ill.

But truth is meaningless if you cannot accept it.

And knowledge is useless if you do not act upon it.

WHAT TRUTH WOULD YOU KNOW AND ACT UPON?"Who is Dakuryon? How do I find him?"

There is a price for this truth:

The life of a stranger.

The life of a mentor.

And the life of a friend.

WILL YOU PAY THIS PRICE?"If I don't, who else?"
You have survived, which signifies that it is Oriyn's will that you find the answer you seek. Tell me, what did Oriyn show you?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Just this glyph..."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

This glyph? How did you happen to select this one?

"It...seemed important, somehow...?"

I ask because Oriyn's knowledge does not manifest as riddles. A single glyph, with a meaning open to interpretation, with no context whatsoever? That seems out of character for the god of knowledge.

Was this all that transpired here?"There was...talk of a price to pay."

Ah, well then. Then, perhaps in that context, this glyph may make some sense.

This glyph can mean many things: visitor, foreigner, outlander...

...stranger."I...I think it means you, Verikam."

Nooo! Dakuryon was disguised as Madat? And Madat is dead?

If I get my hands on you, Dakuryon, I will cut your heart out with a rusty saw!"Rhodos, calm down. We need to make a plan."

I have a plan!

I am going to carve my way through every last archdevan in Dakuryon's army!

I will lay waste to Arx Umbra and turn it into a tomb!

And then I will rip Dakuryon apart and bury the pieces under a thousand tons of rock and fire!"I can't deal with you when you're...like this..."
Who was that? Rhodos seemed to know him—but I've battled the Argon Queen, and never felt anything so powerful...or so evil!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I don't...Wait. Where's Dougal?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

He stayed behind to guard the entrance to the vault.

We should let him know what happened. He saw Madat as a kind of mentor, after all."I will do that."
